text: Metro Cash & Carry Pakistan, also known as Metro-Habib, formerly known as Makro Pakistan, is a Pakistani supermarket chain stores which is a subsidiary of German chain Metro Cash & Carry. The company opened its first store in 2007. It operates 8 supermarkets, in total, in Karachi, Lahore, Islamabad and Faisalabad. ==History== In 2011, Makro and Metro Cash & Carry merged their business in Pakistan. In 2017, it was named as the best place to work in Pakistan. In 2019, they expanded in the Punjab, Pakistan and announced that they are opening a store in Multan.https://tribune.com.pk/story/1908296/2-metro-increase-investment- punjab/ ==See also== *Metro Cash & Carry ==References== Category:Retail companies established in 2007 Category:Supermarkets of Pakistan Category:Mergers and acquisitions of Pakistani companies Category:2011 mergers and acquisitions Category:2007 establishments in Pakistan Category:Pakistani subsidiaries of foreign companies Category:Department stores of Pakistan Category:Companies based in Karachi Category:House of Habib
